title: Lukas Nelson and The Promise of the Real- Wasted   2012  320k
description:
Great stuff it kicks ass but not over the top and the coolest thing is if you live in an urban area they could show up close to ya.
 Why is that cool? Because it also is reversed, if you live off the beaten track in a town of 20,or 30,000 he could appear just down the street from you.
 And he delivers. 
 I swear if you are not looking at him perform you would swear it was Willie about 30 years ago.

 But opted for some good old fashion Rock n Roll.

I urge anyone who gets a chance to go to the his show and see this talented performer.
I have seen them 3 times and it does not get old, they are a breath of fresh air so to speak.
The only reason I am uploading this is they work there asses off and are constantly touring they really need to get some bigger venues to go along with  there home town rock image, but then again that is a big part of the attraction.

Lukas Nelson & Promise of the Real - sometimes referred to as POTR - is an American rock group based out of California.  The band consists of Lukas Nelson (vocals/guitar), Anthony Logerfo (drums), Corey McCormick (bass), and Tato Melgar (percussion). Lukas is the son of Willie Nelson.

Formation of Promise of the Real


Lukas Autry Nelson moved from Paia, Hawaii to Los Angeles in 2007 to attend Loyola Marymount University. In early 2008, Lukas met drummer Anthony LoGerfo at a Neil Young concert. Shortly after, the two began playing music together in Seal Beach, CA.

In October 2008 Lukas dropped out of college to pursue his music career full-time. Lukas called Anthony Logerfo (drummer), Tato Melgar (percussionist), Merlyn Kelly (bassist), and formed Promise of the Real.
Live Beginnings (2008 - 2009)
Lukas Nelson & Promise of the Real performing live in 2012

The band played their first shows in the fall of 2008. They begin selling their first EP Ã¢â‚¬Å“Live BeginningsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ to pay for touring costs. The album contained live tracks recorded off the soundboard at the world famous Ã¢â‚¬Å“Belly UpÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ in Solana Beach, CA.

In January 2009, the band began a nine-show tour opening for Willie Nelson including a five night stop at The Fillmore in San Francisco. Next was a two-week tour with B.B. King through Colorado and Nebraska. Over the course of these dates, the band had completely sold out their stock of Ã¢â‚¬Å“Live BeginningsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ CDs.
Wasted (2012)

The band released their second full length studio album, Wasted, on April 3, 2012. Following the album's release the band embarked on a national tour beginning April 6 at AntoneÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Nightclub in Austin, TX.

Lukas and the band were also featured on an exclusive webcast through Yahoo Music that was shot at TRI Studios (Bob WeirÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s studio). The webcast aired on April 17, 2012 and has been viewed by hundreds of thousands of people. Along with the webcast, the band was featured as the homepage artist on Yahoo music.

On May 1, 2012, Live Nation announced that Lukas Nelson & Promise of the Real would be acting as direct support for John Fogerty on his coast to coast tour of Canada set September 8 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 29, 2012.
